alert.note: Alert for Magoffin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 12:15PM EDT until July 28 at 10:17PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky... Licking River near Salyersville affecting Magoffin County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Licking River near Salyersville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 17.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM EDT Thursday was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.7 feet on 02/23/1985. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by 6 PM EDT.
